channel.title: 2017 on Take Network
channel.description: Recent content in 2017 on Take Network

item.title: Docker
item.description: docker pull jenkins/jenkins:lts docker run -p 8080:8080 -p 50000:50000 -v jenkins_home:/var/jenkins_home jenkins/jenkins:lts available on localhost:8080

item.title: Things I Learned During Advent of Code 2017
item.description: Over the month of December I participated in an advent calendar game called the Advent of Code. Each December from the 1st to the 25th, a new programming puzzle is dished out at 12:00AM EST for you to solve. There’s a bit of a metagame involved where competitive programmers try to race to get to solutions as fast as possible, but it’s still totally fun and a worthwhile set of programming exercises even if you don’t have the stamina to start programming at midnight. I’ve catalogued a few things I learned over the month in the post below.

item.title: Games in 2017
item.description: I played a lot of games in 2017. A lot of them were very, very good- developers put out a surprising number of memorable single player experiences, which are, according to EA, going the way of the dodo in the near future. We also saw a number of new and interesting concepts explored in the multiplayer arena, with For Honor creating an innovative new approach to fighting games, and PUBG taking the world by storm.
